hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 10-day realized volatility drops below 30% (annualized) during a NEUTRAL regime, and price then makes a 2.5%+ move in either direction, fading that initial breakout (taking opposite position) will be profitable over the next 3-7 trading days as volatility expands and price reverts.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low volatility during neutral regimes indicates equilibrium and low conviction. Initial breakouts often trap late momentum traders and fail as market structure lacks follow-through. This is a classic 'false breakout' pattern amplified by crypto's tendency for rapid mean reversion.
entry_conditions: BTC price makes a ≥2.5% move from previous day's close
Entry: Take opposite position at close of the breakout day

exit_conditions.take_profit: 50% retracement of the initial breakout move OR 7 trading days
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price extends another 1.5% in the breakout direction beyond entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Initial breakouts continue in their direction more than 60% of the time when preceded by volatility <30% in neutral regimes.
